Create and configure the necessary Grunt tasks for bundling Personas 3.0 DevTools as Chrome extension.

Source for Chrome DevTools panel is in /src/dev-tools/.
Source for Chrome extension is in /src/chrome-extension/.

Build output is in /dist/chrome-personas-devtools/ folder. (This has to contain all the required files for Chrome extension)

Chrome extension manifest has to be included as well. ([Manifest structure|https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/manifest])

Grunt tasks:
* Run linter
* Minify Chrome extension scripts from /src/chrome-extension/
* Bundle SAP UI5 resources -required- for DevTools panel (Use SAP UI5 bower package)
* Compile Less to CSS
* Minify Chrome DevTools panel scripts from /src/devtools/
* Copy other required resources
Fields.Summary: Configure Chrome extension build using Grunt

Prepare environment for development:
* Configure IDE
* Install Node.js (https://nodejs.org/dist/v5.6.0/node-v5.6.0-x64.msi)
* Chechout  project from SVN (https://svn-rix.exigenservices.com/svn/training/personas/personas3-dev-tools/)
* Run command "npm install" to install node packages
* Download SAP UI5 runtime to "/src/dev-tools/" (https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/downloads/openui5-runtime-1.32.11.zip)
* Create a simple "Hello World" SAP UI5 app and run it using "npm run lite"

Create XML Viewer for displaying formatted Persoans XML models with syntax highlighting and expandable/collapsible sections. Data for XML Viewer is supplied by generic data provider interface, which doesn't contain environment specific code. It will be re-implemented for each of the environments.

Implement XML parser, which takes XML string and creates a document structure, which later can be used for rendering formatted XML with syntax highlighting and element collapsing.
For parsing XML DOMParser can be used.

Implement XML view rendering, which uses XML structure generated by XML parser.
XML nodes without children are displayed in a single line.
XML nodes with children are displayed in 2+x lines, where first line is opening tag with attributes, followed by children node rendered content and ending with closing tag.
XML elements, attributes, attribute values and inner content is styled differently.

Implement Mock Data Provider (sap.personas.devtools.MockDataProvider) for serving static mock Personas data (from XML text files).
DataProvider has following functions:
* getPersonasModel (returns a Promise of Personas Model as XML string)
* getThemeEditorModel (returns a Promise of Theme Editor Model as XML string)

Fields.Description:
*ECDH encryption*
* Two communication participants: Alice and Bob
* Generate public and private keys for Alice
* Generate public and private keys for Bob
* Demonstrate how Alice and Bob obtain the shared secret

Elliptic curve to be used:
E=(p,a,b,G=(Gx,Gy ),n,h)
* p=  0xffffffff ffffffff ffffffff ffffffff ffffffff ffffffff fffffffe fffffc2f
* a=0,
* b=7
* Gx=0x79be667e f9dcbbac 55a06295 ce870b07 029bfcdb 2dce28d9 59f2815b 16f81798
* Gy=0x483ada77 26a3c465 5da4fbfc 0e1108a8 fd17b448 a6855419 9c47d08f fb10d4b8
* n= 0xffffffff ffffffff ffffffff fffffffe baaedce6 af48a03b bfd25e8c d0364141
* h=1

Fields.Description:
Create generic Data Provider class which can be extended into:
* Mock Data Provider 
* Chrome Extension Data Provider

To supply Personas DevTools in chrome extension with data from Personas Client Chrome Extension Data Provider should be used.

REST service with GET method that returns a JSON file with:
Room names,
Light names,
Light states,
Light descriptions.

REST service with PUT method that sets light state when given:
Light Id,
New light state.
And returns data of the light when state has been changed.

REST service with GET method that returns a JSON file with:
Gate name,
Gate state,
Gate description,
Gate ID.

REST service with PUT method that changes gate state.

At the moment XML models are loaded only once. To make it easier to track the changes we should be able to reload XML model data on demand.

Add a label for time when model was loaded.
Add a button for reloading the model.

Create a REST service with GET method that returns:
Ventilation sensor's name,
Ventilation sensor's type,
Ventilation sensor's last measured value,
Ventilator's name,
Ventilator's power,
Ventilator's power settings,
Ventilation system's C02 level.

Create a REST service with PUT method that changes ventilators power when given:
Ventilator's ID,
Ventilator's new power.

Create a REST service with PUT method that changes ventilation systems CO2 level to reach when given:
Ventilation system's ID,
New CO2 level to reach.

To streamline interactions with Personas Client models we should be able to update model UI as the model changes in the Client.

Investigate how model watching from chrome extension could be implemented.
Fields.Summary: Watching for model changes in Personas Client

Fields.Description:
Create a REST with GET method service that returns:
House ID,
House name,
House description,
Security system mode,
Average temperature in the house,
Power consumptioin of house.

Create a REST service with GET method that returns data about rooms in the house:
Room's ID,
Room's name,
Room's description,
Room's temperature,
Room's humidity.
Are any light on in a room.

Create a REST service with a GET method that returns data about heating system:
Trigeminal valve's name,
Trigeminal valve's temperature,
Trigeminal valve's set temperature,
Heating sensor's name,
Heating sensor's temperature,
Heating sensor's description.

Create a REST service with PUT method that changes a trigeminal valve's set temperature when given:
Trigeminal valve's ID,
Trigeminal valve's new temperature to reach.
And returns data of the trigeminal valve.
Fields.Summary: REST service for heating system view.

Fields.Description:
Create a REST service with GET method that returns security system and security zone data:
Security system's ID,
Security system's name,
Security system's description,
Security system's mode,
Security zone's ID,
Security zone's name,
Security zone's description,
security zone's mode.

Create a REST service that changes security zone's mode when given:
Security zone's ID,
Security zone's new mode.
And returns data of the security zone.
Fields.Summary: REST service for security system view.

Fields.Description: At the moment it is possible to see only 1 model, we should add support for displaying and watching multiple models.

At the moment application consists only from one view and layout is quite simple. We should restructure the application so logic for different features is separated. Also UI has to be enhanced so it supports navigation between different tools.

We need to add menu for navigating between different tools and for navigating between different models.
At the moment we only support XML models, but majority of SAP UI5 models are JSON models. We should add support to JSON models with similar functionality to XML models.
When switching between Model tabs, it takes very long time for the content to load - around 5 to 10 seconds. This has huge impact on usability.

Since personas runs in iframe with different domain than the main page we can't run javascript in the iframe from injected scripts. Because of that we need to use chrome.devtools.eval API instead to watch for model changes and relay updates to the chrome extension.

Fields.Summary: REST service for adding a new user

Fields.Description: Create a rest service with PUT method that changes the functionality available for a user when given the new functionality available for the user.

Data provider should be generic, all hard coded references to model names should be removed. As well all the references to UI components should be removed. (at the moment view is passed to _getJsonModel _and _getXmlModel _functions)

Preferably there would be one method for getting model data. (type can be inferred from data string later)

When XML model line is too large to fit in a row scroll bar is added. If the model is large it gets rather hard to navigate and inspect it. We should wrap long lines instead.

Investigate how to achieve line wrapping for XML model. 
One of possible methods could be adjusting data on model side (two types of lines - normal, wrapped).
Fields.Summary: Wrap lines in XML model view

Fields.Description:
We should fully utilize the panel space, so we can present as much data as possible.
At the moment the user area gets cut after it reaches certain width.
Fields.Summary: Dev Tools uses full panel width

Fields.Description:
To increase space for content reduce the unnecessary white-space around the content and position buttons better. See attached image for suggested layout changes.

PS.
The line number element width is reduced to 40px in the image.

There are some models, that can change several times per second. This causes very frequent model re-rendering in Models view and cause performance issues. We should throttle updates to the model to 1 update per second. That should reduce the performance footprint and keep the UI responsive.

One of possible solutions.
When a new update comes check, when was the last time it was updated, if it's less than a second ago create a timeout for update, if it's been longer then fetch new data.

Alerts shouldn't be used for relaying error messages. Create a class for message handling with MessageToast and use it instead.

Message handling class should have the following functions:
* Display Error Message
* Display Warning Message
* Display Info Message
* Display Success Message
Remove unused components and code and fix major sonar issues.

Fields.Description: Allow user to edit JSON model property values from DevTools panel. When user changes the value in DevTools panel _setProperty _ function should be called to the model in Personas client.
Create GUI for adding/removing editable control properties to Flavor and Theme editors.

Configure routing for the following pages:
# My report
# Overview
# Settings

Create appropriate UI tests to make sure the navigation direct URL's work.

This view should contain a form for entering a list of tasks.
On load the form should be updated by the previous values.

The tasks should be grouped by status types and it should be easy to do incremental updates.
The form state should be local and global state should only be updated on save/submit.

Save action updates the global state.
Submit action adds the report to the report list and updates the global state.

Configure Jenkins to:
* build UI5 app
* run tests for UI5 app
* run server side tests
* deploy app

Enhance gulp build configuration.

Create the following web services:
* Get all reports
* Get report by id
* Get my latest report - returns the latest report for the given user
* Create new report
* Save report (updates report data)
* Delete report
Fields.Summary: Create REST services for managing reports

Fields.Description:
Create database schema for reports.
Modify the web services from TRAINING-221 to save and retrieve data using database.

Create login page from which users can use to log in with domain users.
It should have:
* User name field
* Password field
* Save button

Also add user menu to the header toolbar, similar to [https://www.sapfioritrial.com/sites?helpset=trial&sap-client=001]. 

If the user is not logged in show log in button.
If the user is logged in then show user first name and last name and add log out option to the menu.

To create daily reports on the client side we need a list of submitted reports for the given time period.

GET *SubmittedReports*
Input:
* Start date
* End date

Output:
A list of submitted reports, that are within the specified time frame.

We also need CRUD services for report Overviews.

POST *CreateOverview*
Input:
* Start date
* End date
* Content

GET *Overview*
Input:
* Start date (optional)
* End date (optional)

Output:
Array of Overviews, if no interval is specified return all.

GET *Overview*
Input:
* id

Output:
Returns Overview by id.

Put *Overview*
Updates the specified (id) overview.
Input:
* id
* Start date
* End date
* Content

Output:
Overview with the updated values.

Delete *Overview*
Deletes the overview.
Input:
* id

Overview model properties:
* Start date (timestamp)
* End date (timestamp)
* Content (string)
* Published (boolean)

Implement admin user creation during first application launch.

Create User service:
Input: username
Output: initial password
Creates user and generates initial password, which is returned only once as a response to this request.

Delete User service:
Input: username
Marks user as deleted, but does not delete the document from the database. (soft delete)

Change Password service:
Input: username, password, new password
Updates users password if provided current password is correct.

Create User Group:
Input: group name, order number
Creates a group with arbitrary name.

Update Group:
Input: id, group name, order number.
Updates user group, group identified by id.

Get Groups:
Output: all groups

Delete group:
Input: id.
Marks group as deleted, but does not delete the document.

Assign user to Group:
Input: groupId, userId
Adds user to the group.

Create settings page with 2 sections for admins (regular users can not see these sections):
* user settings, where users can be created, deleted or user password can be changed
* report settings, where user groups can be created, deleted, updated and user assigned to the group

Create settings section for users, where they can change their password.

Features:
* (admin only) Create overview for given time frame (start date, end date), with default to current day. It takes all of submitted reports for the time frame and groups and generates a report. 
* (admin only) Edit overview - allow to change the content of the report overview.
* List view, list all of the reports
* Preview report - displays the overview (read only).
Complete JavaScript course [https://github.com/wesbos/JavaScript30.]

Create a simple vanilla JavaScript application, that displays SpaceX launches. Data can be retrieved from [https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API].

Features:
 * List of past launches
 * List  of upcoming launches

 

About each launch there should be at lest the following details:
 * Date
 * Rocket
 * Launch Site
 * Payloads
 * Launch Sucess
 * Landing Success
 * Links

 

Note: application should be modular (use ES6 modules).

Learn the concepets described in section "Basics" https://wiki.returnonintelligence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=205706945.

Prepare environment for development:
* Configure IDE
* Install Node.js (https://nodejs.org/dist/v5.6.0/node-v5.6.0-x64.msi)
* Chechout  project from SVN (https://svn-rix.exigenservices.com/svn/training/personas/personas3-dev-tools/)
* Run command "npm install" to install node packages
* Download SAP UI5 runtime to "/src/dev-tools/" (https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/downloads/openui5-runtime-1.32.11.zip)
* Create a simple "Hello World" SAP UI5 app and run it using "npm run lite"

Create XML Viewer for displaying formatted Persoans XML models with syntax highlighting and expandable/collapsible sections. Data for XML Viewer is supplied by generic data provider interface, which doesn't contain environment specific code. It will be re-implemented for each of the environments.

Implement XML parser, which takes XML string and creates a document structure, which later can be used for rendering formatted XML with syntax highlighting and element collapsing.
For parsing XML DOMParser can be used.

Implement XML view rendering, which uses XML structure generated by XML parser.
XML nodes without children are displayed in a single line.
XML nodes with children are displayed in 2+x lines, where first line is opening tag with attributes, followed by children node rendered content and ending with closing tag.
XML elements, attributes, attribute values and inner content is styled differently.

Implement Mock Data Provider (sap.personas.devtools.MockDataProvider) for serving static mock Personas data (from XML text files).
DataProvider has following functions:
* getPersonasModel (returns a Promise of Personas Model as XML string)
* getThemeEditorModel (returns a Promise of Theme Editor Model as XML string)

Fields.Description:
*ECDH encryption*
* Two communication participants: Alice and Bob
* Generate public and private keys for Alice
* Generate public and private keys for Bob
* Demonstrate how Alice and Bob obtain the shared secret

Elliptic curve to be used:
E=(p,a,b,G=(Gx,Gy ),n,h)
* p=  0xffffffff ffffffff ffffffff ffffffff ffffffff ffffffff fffffffe fffffc2f
* a=0,
* b=7
* Gx=0x79be667e f9dcbbac 55a06295 ce870b07 029bfcdb 2dce28d9 59f2815b 16f81798
* Gy=0x483ada77 26a3c465 5da4fbfc 0e1108a8 fd17b448 a6855419 9c47d08f fb10d4b8
* n= 0xffffffff ffffffff ffffffff fffffffe baaedce6 af48a03b bfd25e8c d0364141
* h=1

REST service with GET method that returns a JSON file with:
Room names,
Light names,
Light states,
Light descriptions.

Gate name,
Gate state,

REST service with PUT method that changes gate state.

At the moment XML models are loaded only once. To make it easier to track the changes we should be able to reload XML model data on demand.

Add a label for time when model was loaded.
Add a button for reloading the model.

Ventilation sensor's name,

Ventilator's ID,
Ventilator's new power.

Create a REST service with PUT method that changes ventilation systems CO2 level to reach when given:
Ventilation system's ID,
New CO2 level to reach.

Fields.Description: At the moment it is possible to see only 1 model, we should add support for displaying and watching multiple models.

At the moment application consists only from one view and layout is quite simple. We should restructure the application so logic for different features is separated. Also UI has to be enhanced so it supports navigation between different tools.

We need to add menu for navigating between different tools and for navigating between different models.
At the moment we only support XML models, but majority of SAP UI5 models are JSON models. We should add support to JSON models with similar functionality to XML models.
When switching between Model tabs, it takes very long time for the content to load - around 5 to 10 seconds. This has huge impact on usability.

Since personas runs in iframe with different domain than the main page we can't run javascript in the iframe from injected scripts. Because of that we need to use chrome.devtools.eval API instead to watch for model changes and relay updates to the chrome extension.

Fields.Summary: REST service for adding a new user

Fields.Description: Create a rest service with PUT method that changes the functionality available for a user when given the new functionality available for the user.

Data provider should be generic, all hard coded references to model names should be removed. As well all the references to UI components should be removed. (at the moment view is passed to _getJsonModel _and _getXmlModel _functions)

Preferably there would be one method for getting model data. (type can be inferred from data string later)

When XML model line is too large to fit in a row scroll bar is added. If the model is large it gets rather hard to navigate and inspect it. We should wrap long lines instead.

Investigate how to achieve line wrapping for XML model. 
One of possible methods could be adjusting data on model side (two types of lines - normal, wrapped).
Fields.Summary: Wrap lines in XML model view

Fields.Description:
We should fully utilize the panel space, so we can present as much data as possible.
At the moment the user area gets cut after it reaches certain width.
Fields.Summary: Dev Tools uses full panel width

Fields.Description:
To increase space for content reduce the unnecessary white-space around the content and position buttons better. See attached image for suggested layout changes.

PS.
The line number element width is reduced to 40px in the image.

There are some models, that can change several times per second. This causes very frequent model re-rendering in Models view and cause performance issues. We should throttle updates to the model to 1 update per second. That should reduce the performance footprint and keep the UI responsive.

One of possible solutions.
When a new update comes check, when was the last time it was updated, if it's less than a second ago create a timeout for update, if it's been longer then fetch new data.

Alerts shouldn't be used for relaying error messages. Create a class for message handling with MessageToast and use it instead.

Message handling class should have the following functions:
* Display Error Message
* Display Warning Message
* Display Info Message
* Display Success Message

# My report

Create appropriate UI tests to make sure the navigation direct URL's work.

This view should contain a form for entering a list of tasks.
On load the form should be updated by the previous values.

The tasks should be grouped by status types and it should be easy to do incremental updates.
The form state should be local and global state should only be updated on save/submit.

Save action updates the global state.
Submit action adds the report to the report list and updates the global state.

Fields.Summary: Create REST services for managing reports

Fields.Description:
Create database schema for reports.
Modify the web services from TRAINING-221 to save and retrieve data using database.

Create login page from which users can use to log in with domain users.
It should have:
* User name field
* Password field
* Save button

Also add user menu to the header toolbar, similar to [https://www.sapfioritrial.com/sites?helpset=trial&sap-client=001]. 

If the user is not logged in show log in button.
If the user is logged in then show user first name and last name and add log out option to the menu.

To create daily reports on the client side we need a list of submitted reports for the given time period.

GET *SubmittedReports*
Input:
* Start date
* End date

Output:
A list of submitted reports, that are within the specified time frame.

We also need CRUD services for report Overviews.

POST *CreateOverview*
Input:
* Start date
* End date
* Content

GET *Overview*
Input:
* Start date (optional)
* End date (optional)

Output:
Array of Overviews, if no interval is specified return all.

GET *Overview*
Input:
* id

Output:
Returns Overview by id.

Put *Overview*
Updates the specified (id) overview.
Input:
* id
* Start date
* End date
* Content

Output:
Overview with the updated values.

Delete *Overview*
Deletes the overview.
Input:
* id

Overview model properties:
* Start date (timestamp)
* End date (timestamp)
* Content (string)
* Published (boolean)

Implement admin user creation during first application launch.

Create User service:
Input: username
Output: initial password
Creates user and generates initial password, which is returned only once as a response to this request.

Delete User service:
Input: username
Marks user as deleted, but does not delete the document from the database. (soft delete)

Change Password service:
Input: username, password, new password
Updates users password if provided current password is correct.

Create User Group:
Input: group name, order number
Creates a group with arbitrary name.

Update Group:
Input: id, group name, order number.
Updates user group, group identified by id.

Get Groups:
Output: all groups

Delete group:
Input: id.
Marks group as deleted, but does not delete the document.

Assign user to Group:
Input: groupId, userId
Adds user to the group.

Create settings page with 2 sections for admins (regular users can not see these sections):
* user settings, where users can be created, deleted or user password can be changed
* report settings, where user groups can be created, deleted, updated and user assigned to the group

Create settings section for users, where they can change their password.

Features:
* (admin only) Create overview for given time frame (start date, end date), with default to current day. It takes all of submitted reports for the time frame and groups and generates a report. 
* (admin only) Edit overview - allow to change the content of the report overview.
* List view, list all of the reports
* Preview report - displays the overview (read only).
Complete JavaScript course [https://github.com/wesbos/JavaScript30.]

Create a simple vanilla JavaScript application, that displays SpaceX launches. Data can be retrieved from [https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API].

Features:
 * List of past launches
 * List  of upcoming launches

 

About each launch there should be at lest the following details:
 * Date
 * Rocket
 * Launch Site
 * Payloads
 * Launch Sucess
 * Landing Success
 * Links

 

Note: application should be modular (use ES6 modules).
